attributes.action: Abandon all "plans" to store every text message and email sent in britain, and to record every website visited, and if this is already happening without us knowing, cease doing it
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The government is planning to store every text message and email sent in Great Britain. They are also planning to make a record of every website visited. This is an invasion of our privacy. People may say that they have nothing to hide, but our private life should be private- there are plenty of things that people have a perfectly valid reason to want to keep private. 

This petition is a demand for action, not an e-mail saying why the government is choosing to ignore the respondents to this petition.
